sentences.sContent: Britain has to pursue policies in concert with other EU members.
sentences.sCn: 英国必须和其他欧盟成员国一起贯彻各项政策。

sentences.sContent: It appeared that both the accused were acting in concert in the attack upon the deceased.
sentences.sCn: 两名被告看来是合力袭击死者的。

sentences.sContent: ...all three must work in concert for the true benefits of end-users...
...What a great singer Justin is! His concert is just awesome and you’ll never regret the money you paid for the ticket...

phrases.pCn: 和…相呼应；与…合作；和…一致
去听音乐会，去参加音乐会
流行音乐会；通俗音乐会

words.tran: 协调的；协定的；商议定的

trans.tranOther: people who do something in concert do it together after having agreed on it
